title: 109_s2614
content: The Act may be cited as the "Alternative Energy Refueling System Act of 2006" and pertains to alternative energy refueling systems. The Solid Waste Disposal Act is amended to include definitions for alternative energy refueling systems, which are used to refuel vehicles with compressed natural gas, E-85 ethanol, or other specified fuels. The Solid Waste Disposal Act is amended to include definitions for alternative energy refueling systems, used to refuel vehicles with compressed natural gas, E-85 ethanol, or other specified fuels. Eligible entities are defined as refueling vendors or owners/operators of facilities with alternative energy refueling systems. A reimbursement program is also established. The Administrator will establish a reimbursement program for eligible entities to receive Trust Fund reimbursement for purchasing and installing alternative energy refueling systems. The Administrator will establish a reimbursement program for eligible entities to receive Trust Fund reimbursement for purchasing and installing alternative energy refueling systems, including replacements for petroleum systems. Eligible entities must submit an application with required information to receive reimbursement within 30 days of verification by the Administrator and State agency. The Administrator will provide reimbursement to eligible entities for alternative energy refueling systems within 30 days of installation and verification. An eligible entity cannot receive dual benefits. The Administrator will reimburse eligible entities for alternative energy refueling systems within 30 days of installation and verification, with a limitation on receiving dual benefits. The Administrator will reimburse eligible entities for up to 2 alternative energy refueling systems per facility, with no reimbursement if the system cost was factored into tax credit calculations. Eligible entities can receive reimbursement for up to 2 alternative energy refueling systems per facility, with the reimbursement amount capped at 30% of the system cost. The reimbursement amount for alternative energy refueling systems is capped at 30% of the system cost or $30,000, whichever is less. The Administrator cannot use Trust Fund funds obligated for other projects to carry out this paragraph. The Administrator is restricted from using Trust Fund funds allocated for other projects to implement the activities described in the paragraph. Additionally, a conforming amendment is made to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986.
